intro: Cerasus padus var. bracteosa, commonly known as the bracteosa cherry, is a variant of the European bird cherry. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 2–5 meters. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers that appear in clusters, followed by small, edible berries. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a serrated margin. The species is native to Europe and parts of western Asia, and it is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
